articles.author: Boateng Dickson
articles.description:
In the early days of the internet, you needed a server to store data. But nowadays, through LocalStorage, you can store data on browsers and applications without communicating with a back-end server.
In this article, you will learn about the theoretical and practical applications of LocalStorage in JavaScript.
Before we hop into the real deal, let's look at the definition of web storage. Web storage is one of the great features of HTML5 that allows web applications to store data locally within a user's browser. 
The two most common forms of web storage are LocalStorage and Session Storage. The key difference between these two forms of web storage is that data saved in LocalStorage never leaves the browser and remains there until you explicitly remove it. In contrast, data stored in Session‚Ä¶
articles.title: JavaScript Local Storage Explained!

articles.author: Christian Peters
articles.description:
A headless CMS is a content management system that provides a way to create, edit, and deliver content to one or several frontends. Instead of having your content tightly coupled to a particular frontend (like a website or mobile app), it provides your content as data over an API to be served to any frontend.
A headless CMS is a backend-only content management system, making content accessible via an API for display on any device, without a built-in front-end or presentation layer.
It is a content management system that delivers content as data to any platform or device via API, rather than having it tightly coupled to a specific website or mobile app. In practice, this means that teams are able to use a single content repository, or CMS, to deliver content from a single source to endless ‚Ä¶
articles.title: What is a headless CMS & when should I be using it?

articles.author: Shai Almog
articles.description:
In the past year or so, people started writing about the phenomenon of quiet quitting. It isn‚Äôt new, but it somehow became trendy as more people are doing this. This isn‚Äôt something I care about as much. People often describe me as a workaholic which is pretty accurate, and I love it. But I totally get the problem that triggers quiet quitting and its root is in a lack of loyalty. A cursory reader might think I‚Äôm blaming the employee for lack of loyalty, I am. But loyalty is a two-way street and some employees are merely reflecting something that we‚Äôve been conditioned to accept for the past few decades.
Back in the days when I formed my consulting company and later on Codename One, I read pretty much every business management book I could find. Back in 2014 I read a rare book in that genre‚Ä¶
articles.title: Quiet Quitting is About Loyalty

articles.author: baseballhub
articles.description:
What is a Hold in baseball?
HOLD is a situation that occurs when a relief pitcher enters the game while his team is in the lead. After entering the game, he keeps the lead till the next pitcher enters the game and while maintaining this lead the pitcher also takes one wicket. So, now you know the definition of a HOLD in Baseball.
What is a hold in baseball 
Another way of hold baseball definition
The main job of a relief pitcher is not to get the team to win but rather to hold on to the lead they already have. The relief pitchers are not closed and they know this. Their primary objective is to keep the lead their predecessors have given them. They need to do the same for the next pitcher.
Meanwhile holding onto the lead if a pitcher successfully scores an out, is called a HOLD or BLOWN SAV‚Ä¶
articles.title: What is a hold in baseball. Hold baseball definition (update 2022)

articles.author: Ezekiel nwuguru
articles.description:
Hey! It's day 4 of I4G 10 days of coding challenge. Today's task was to implement a code that prints in order.
Thought process: 
Understanding of problem: My first approach in solving this challenge was to understand the problem. Understanding of the problem paved way for me to brainstorm on possible solutions. The way an operating system schedules a thread varies; we cannot predict the order in which the thread can be executed. The task here is to modify a code such that the first thread is always executed first, the second executed second and so on.


Solution: To achieve this, I utilized one of the Java classes called Semaphore. Semaphore helps to restrict the number of threads that can access some (physical or logical) resource. The Semaphore class maintains a set of permits. It utilizes the acquire() method to block further executions until a permit is available. It uses the release() method to give a permit, thus releasing a potentially blocking acquirer. 


Algorithm:




Create two instances of the Semaphore class: semaphore1 and semaphore2
Add semaphore1.release() to the end of the first thread
Add semaphore1.acquire() to the beginning of the second thread
Add semaphore2.release() to the end of the second thread
Add semaphore2.acquire() to the beginning of the third thread
Check out the full java code here: Print in Order - LeetCode https://leetcode.com/problems/print-in-order/submissions/
articles.title: DAY 4: Print in order

articles.author: Jelle Smeets
articles.description:
I am a master procrastinator. I have tried several productivity methods to get me to stop procrastinating. Most of these tools did not work for me. The 2-minute rule however is one of the few that does.
The 2-minute rule is crazy simple, and that is why it works. Here is what you need to know.
How do you beat procrastination? By taking action. The biggest hurdle is getting started. And once I am started I usually will stick around for a while. This is the power of the 2-minute rule. Created by David Allen in his book Getting things done.
If an action will take less than two minutes, it should be done at the moment it‚Äôs defined.
David Allen
Why does it work? Often the biggest hurdle is to get started. Once you are already active, it's easier to keep going. Like Isaac Newton said: "An object‚Ä¶
articles.title: How the 2-minute rule improved my life

Hey guys,
In this article I will show you how I built a breakout game using HTML canvas, CSS and Javascript. Using a single ball, the player must knock down as many bricks as possible by using the walls and/or the paddle below to hit the ball against the bricks and eliminate them.
In this game, you will have 3 lives, and you must hit the ball against the bricks and eliminate them. If you are not able to eliminate the bricks within 3 lives, then your game is over.
Why did I want to create this game ?
I want to familiarise myself with using HTML Canvas and the flexibility of building a game with it.
Setup for the project
This game is best viewed or played on a desktop computer with the help of a mouse pointer.
Let's start coding !!!
The project structure consists of only 3 files.
|__ style.c‚Ä¶

So for days, I have been keen on how I could possibly increase the performance of this website, then I discovered one very simple and important trick which we will be discussing here.

AIOps ÂØπ‰∫éÊàêÂäüÁöÑÊï∞Â≠óÂåñËΩ¨ÂûãËá≥ÂÖ≥ÈáçË¶ÅÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Â∏ÆÂä©Á≥ªÁªü‰ª•Áé∞‰ª£‰∏öÂä°ÊâÄÈúÄÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶ËøêË°å„ÄÇÂèçËøáÊù•ÔºåËøôÂ∞ÜÁ°ÆÂÆöÂÖ¨Âè∏Ëé∑ÂæóÂíå‰øùÊåÅÂ∏ÇÂú∫È¢ÜÂÖàÂú∞‰ΩçÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶„ÄÇ

Áé∞‰ª£ AIOps ÊäÄÊúØÂú®Êú¨Âú∞„ÄÅ‰∫ëÁ´ØÊàñÊ∑∑ÂêàÁéØÂ¢É‰∏≠Êèê‰æõ IT Âü∫Á°ÄÊû∂ÊûÑ„ÄÇÂÆÉ‰ª¨ÁöÑËá™Âä®Âåñ‰ΩøÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòËÉΩÂ§ü‰∏ìÊ≥®‰∫éËÆæËÆ°‰∏ã‰∏Ä‰ª£‰∏öÂä°Â∫îÁî®ÔºåËÄå‰∏çÂøÖÊãÖÂøÉÂ∫ïÂ±ÇÂü∫Á°ÄËÆæÊñΩ„ÄÇ

‰ªÄ‰πàÊòØ AIOpsÔºü

AIOps ÁªìÂêà‰∫∫Â∑•Êô∫ËÉΩÂíåÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†Êù•ÂàÜÊûê IT ËøêËê•ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇËøôÊòØÂ∞Ü‰∫∫Â∑•Êô∫ËÉΩÂ∫îÁî®‰∫é IT ËøêËê•ÁöÑËøáÁ®ã„ÄÇÂÆÉÂèØ‰ª•Â∏ÆÂä©ÁªÑÁªá‰∏ªÂä®Ê£ÄÊµãÈîôËØØÔºåËøòÂèØ‰ª•Â∏ÆÂä©ËøêËê•Âõ¢ÈòüÂú®ÈóÆÈ¢òÂΩ±ÂìçÊúÄÁªàÁî®Êà∑‰πãÂâçÈ¢ÑÈò≤ÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ

‰º†ÁªüÁöÑ IT ÁÆ°ÁêÜÊäÄÊúØÂ∑≤ÁªèÊó†Ê≥ïÂ∫îÂØπÊï∞Â≠óÂåñ‰∏öÂä°ËΩ¨Âûã„ÄÇÂΩì Gartner ÂàõÈÄ† AIOps ‰∏ÄËØçÊó∂ÔºåËØ•ÂÖ¨Âè∏È¢ÑÊµã IT ËøêËê•ËøáÁ®ãÂ∞ÜÂèëÁîüÈáçÂ§ßÂèòÂåñÔºåÁªÑÁªáÁÆ°ÁêÜÂÖ∂ IT ÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÊñπÂºè‰πü‰ºöÂèëÁîüÂ∑®Â§ßÂèòÂåñ„ÄÇ

AIOps Âπ≥Âè∞‰ΩøÁî®Â§ßÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇ‰ªñ‰ª¨‰ªéÂêÑÁßç IT ËøêËê•ÂíåËÆæÂ§áÊî∂ÈõÜÊï∞ÊçÆÔºå‰ª•Ëá™Âä®ËØÜÂà´ÂíåÂÆûÊó∂ÂìçÂ∫îÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂêåÊó∂‰ªçÊèê‰æõ‰º†ÁªüÁöÑÂéÜÂè≤ÂàÜÊûê„ÄÇÁÑ∂ÂêéÔºåAIOps ‰ΩøÁî®Êú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†ÂØπÁªÑÂêàÁöÑ IT Êï∞ÊçÆÊâßË°åÁªºÂêàÂàÜÊûê„ÄÇ

ÁªìÊûúÊòØËá™Âä®ÂåñÈ©±Âä®ÁöÑÊ¥ûÂØüÂäõÈ©±‰ΩøÊåÅÁª≠ÊîπËøõÂíå‰øÆÂ§ç„ÄÇAIOps ÊîØÊåÅÂü∫Êú¨ IT ÂäüËÉΩÁöÑÊåÅÁª≠ÈõÜÊàêÂíåÈÉ®ÁΩ≤ ÔºàCI/CDÔºâ„ÄÇ

ÂºÄÂßã‰ΩøÁî® AIOps ÊúÄÂàù‰ºº‰πéÂÖ∑ÊúâÊåëÊàòÊÄßÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ÊúÄÂ•ΩÈááÂèñÂæ™Â∫èÊ∏êËøõÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ï„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨ÈúÄË¶Å‰ªéËØÜÂà´ÂíåÁêÜËß£ IT ËøêËê•Êï∞ÊçÆÂºÄÂßã„ÄÇ AIOps ÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÊòØÊï∞ÊçÆÈ©±Âä®„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÂÆÉÈúÄË¶ÅËÆøÈóÆÊâÄÊúâÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÊìç‰ΩúÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÂåÖÊã¨ÈùûÁªìÊûÑÂåñÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÅÊó•Âøó„ÄÅÊåáÊ†á„ÄÅÂÆûÊó∂Êï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÅAPI ËæìÂá∫ÂíåËÆæÂ§áÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇËøòÈúÄË¶ÅÁªìÊûÑÂåñÁöÑ‰∏öÂä°Êï∞ÊçÆÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ì„ÄÅÁ§æ‰∫§Ê¥ªÂä®ÂíåÂÖ∂‰ªñÂÖ≥Á≥ªÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇ AIOps Âπ≥Âè∞Â§ÑÁêÜÁöÑÁõ∏ÂÖ≥Êï∞ÊçÆË∂äÂ§öÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÈ¢ÑÊµãÂ∞±Ë∂äÂáÜÁ°Æ„ÄÇ

‰ºÅ‰∏öÈúÄË¶Å‰∫ÜËß£‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂ∏ÆÂä©‰ªñ‰ª¨Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÊúÄÂ§ßÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊó†ËÆ∫‰ªñ‰ª¨Ë∫´Â§ÑÂì™‰∏™Ë°å‰∏ö„ÄÇ‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∫îËØ•ÂÆûÊñΩ AIOps Êù•ÂõûÈ°æ‰ªñ‰ª¨ËøáÂéªÁöÑÂ§±Ë¥•ÔºåÂπ∂Á°ÆÂÆöÂì™‰∫õÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∞ÜÂ∏ÆÂä©‰ªñ‰ª¨ÊâæÂà∞Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°à„ÄÇ

Êï∞ÊçÆÂàÜÊûêÂèØÁî®‰∫éÊü•Êâæ‰∏≠Êñ≠ÊàñÁ≥ªÁªüÂèòÊÖ¢ÁöÑÊ†πÊ∫ê„ÄÇÁÑ∂Âêé AIOps Âπ≥Âè∞ÂèØÁî®‰∫éÊ£ÄÊµãÂ∏∏ËßÅÈóÆÈ¢òÂèäÂÖ∂Ë°•ÊïëÊé™ÊñΩ„ÄÇ‰ºÅ‰∏öÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®Êî∂ÈõÜÂà∞ÁöÑÁªìÊûúÊù•ÂÆûÊñΩÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†Âíå AIÔºå‰ª•ËøõË°åÂÆûÊó∂ÁõëÊéßÂíåËá™Âä®ÂìçÂ∫î„ÄÇËøôÊï¥‰∏™ËøáÁ®ãÂ∏ÆÂä©ÂÖ¨Âè∏Êé®Âä® AI ÊàêÁÜüÔºåÊúâÊïàÂú∞‰øÆÂ§çÈîôËØØÔºåÈÅøÂÖçÂÅúÊú∫ÔºåÊèêÈ´òÊïàÁéá„ÄÇ

ÁªÑÁªáÊ≠£Âú®‰ªé‰º†ÁªüÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®Êû∂ÊûÑËΩ¨ÁßªÂà∞‰∫ëÂéüÁîü„ÄÅÁÅµÊ¥ªÂíåÂü∫‰∫éÂæÆÊúçÂä°ÁöÑÂÆπÂô®ÂåñÂ∫îÁî®Â†ÜÊ†à„ÄÇ

ÂºÇÂ∏∏Ê£ÄÊµã„ÄÅÂàÜÁ±ªÂíåÈ¢ÑÊµãÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøá‰ΩøÁî®Êú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†ÂíåÊ∑±Â∫¶Â≠¶‰π†Ê®°ÂûãÊù•ÂÆåÊàêÔºåËøô‰∫õÊ®°ÂûãÊìÖÈïøÂàÜÊûêÊµ∑ÈáèÊï∞ÊçÆÂπ∂Êèê‰æõÂàÜÊûê„ÄÇAIOps ÁöÑËÆ∏Â§öÂäüËÉΩÂèØÂ∏ÆÂä©ÂÖ¨Âè∏ÈÄöËøá‰∫§‰∫íÂºè‰ª™Ë°®ÁõòÊèê‰æõËâØÂ•ΩÁöÑÁî®Êà∑‰ΩìÈ™å„ÄÇ

ÂÆûÊñΩ AIOps ÁöÑ‰ºÅ‰∏öÊä•Âëä‰∫ÜËØ∏Â¶ÇÊó†Áºù‰ΩìÈ™å„ÄÅÊõ¥‰ΩéÁöÑËøêËê•Ë¥πÁî®„ÄÅÊõ¥Âø´ÁöÑÂÆ¢Êà∑ÊúçÂä°„ÄÅÊõ¥Áü≠ÁöÑÂπ≥ÂùáËß£ÂÜ≥Êó∂Èó¥ÂíåÊõ¥Â∞ëÁöÑÂÅúÊú∫Êó∂Èó¥Á≠âÂ•ΩÂ§Ñ„ÄÇ AIOps ÈÄöËøáÂü∫‰∫éÈ¢ÑÊµãÂàÜÊûêÂÅöÂá∫ÂùöÂÆöÁöÑÂÜ≥Á≠ñÊù•ÊîØÊåÅ IT ËøêËê•„ÄÇ

sign in (login/pass only, no FB/Meta/whatsoever support, no Smart Lock either)

What's in progress:

"Now Playing" improvements
better service (notification improvements)

articles.author: Seth Kenlon
articles.description:
Drop your database for PostgreSQL
Seth Kenlon
Sat, 09/24/2022 - 03:00

            
Databases are tools to store information in an organized but flexible way. A spreadsheet is essentially a database, but the constraints of a graphical application render most spreadsheet applications useless to programmers. With Edge and IoT devices becoming significant target platforms, developers need powerful but lightweight solutions for storing, processing, and querying large amounts of data. One of my favourite combinations is the PostgreSQL database and Lua bindings, but the possibilities are endless. Whatever language you use, Postgres is a great choice for a database, but you need to know some basics before adopting it.
Install Postgres
To install PostgreSQL on Linux, use your software repository. ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Drop your database for PostgreSQL

articles.author: Raigor Jiang
articles.description:
How to build a dynamic distributed database with DistSQL
Raigor Jiang
Fri, 09/23/2022 - 03:00

            
Distributed databases are common for many reasons. They increase reliability, redundancy, and performance. Apache ShardingSphere is an open source framework that enables you to transform any database into a distributed database. Since the release of ShardingSphere 5.0.0, DistSQL (Distributed SQL) has provided dynamic management for the ShardingSphere ecosystem.
In this article, I demonstrate a data sharding scenario in which DistSQL's flexibility allows you to create a distributed database. At the same time, I show some syntax sugar to simplify operating procedures, allowing your potential users to choose their preferred syntax.
A series of DistSQL statements are run through practica‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to build a dynamic distributed database with DistSQL

articles.author: Seth Kenlon
articles.description:
Install JDBC on Linux in 3 steps
Seth Kenlon
Fri, 09/23/2022 - 03:00

            
When you write an application, it's common to require data storage. Sometimes you're storing assets your application needs to function, and other times you're storing user data, including preferences and save data. One way to store data is in a database, and in order to communicate between your code and a database, you need a database binding or connector for your language. For Java, a common database connector is JDBC (Java database connectivity.)
1. Install Java
Of course, to develop with Java you must also have Java installed. I recommend SDKman for Linux, macOS, and WSL or Cygwin. For Windows, you can download OpenJDK from developers.redhat.com.

More on Java
What is enterprise Java programming?
Red Hat ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Install JDBC on Linux in 3 steps

articles.description:
5 Git configurations I make on Linux
Alan Formy-Duval
Thu, 09/22/2022 - 03:00

            
Setting up Git on Linux is simple, but here are the five things I do to get the perfect configuration:
Create global configuration
Set default name
Set default email address
Set default branch name
Set default editor
I manage my code, shell scripts, and documentation versioning using Git. This means that for each new project I start, the first step is to create a directory for its content and make it into a Git repository:
$ mkdir newproject
cd newproject
git init



            
More on Git
What is Git?
Git cheat sheet
Markdown cheat sheet
New Git articles
There are certain general settings that I always want. Not many, but enough that I don't want to have to repeat the configuration each time. I l‚Ä¶
articles.title: 5 Git configurations I make on Linux

articles.author: Stephan Avenwedde
articles.description:
6 Python interpreters to try in 2022
Stephan Avenwedde
Wed, 09/21/2022 - 03:00

            
Python, one of the most popular programming languages, requires an interpreter to execute the instructions defined by the Python code. In contrast to other languages, which compile directly into machine code, it‚Äôs up to the interpreter to read Python code and translate its instructions for the CPU performing the related actions. There are several interpreters out there, and in this article, I‚Äôll take a look at a few of them.
Primer to interpreters
When talking about the Python interpreter, it‚Äôs usually the /usr/bin/python binary being referred to. That lets you execute a .py file.
Lexing - The human-made source code is converted into a sequence of logical entities, the so called lexical tokens.
Par‚Ä¶
articles.title: 6 Python interpreters to try in 2022

articles.author: Amar Gandhi
articles.description:
My favorite open source alternatives to Notion
Amar Gandhi
Wed, 09/21/2022 - 03:00

            
If you have notes to yourself scattered throughout your hard drive, you might need a notes application to collect and organize your personal reminders. A notes system can help you track ideas, important tasks, and works in progress. A popular application that isn't open source is Notion, but here are two options that respect your privacy and data.
Standard Notes
Standard Notes is an open source (AGPL 3.0 license) notes application featuring a password manager, a to-do list, and, of course, a great system for writing and storing notes.
One of the most important things about taking notes is finding them again, so organization is critical. Standard Notes uses an intuitive and natural tagging syste‚Ä¶
articles.title: My favorite open source alternatives to Notion

articles.author: Don Watkins
articles.description:
3 ways to use the Linux inxi command
Don Watkins
Tue, 09/20/2022 - 03:00

            
I was looking for information about the health of my laptop battery when I stumbled upon inxi. It's a command line system information tool that provides a wealth of information about your Linux computer, whether it's a laptop, desktop, or server.
The inxi command is licensed with the GPLv3, and many Linux distributions include it. According to its Git repository: "inxi strives to support the widest range of operating systems and hardware, from the most simple consumer desktops, to the most advanced professional hardware and servers."
Documentation is robust, and the project maintains a complete man page online. Once installed, you can access the man page on your system with the man inxi command.

More Li‚Ä¶
articles.title: 3 ways to use the Linux inxi command

articles.author: Seth Kenlon
articles.description:
Security buzzwords to avoid and what to say instead
Seth Kenlon
Tue, 09/20/2022 - 03:00

            
Technology is a little famous for coming up with "buzzwords." Other industries do it, too, of course. "Story-driven" and "rules light" tabletop games are a big thing right now, "deconstructed" burgers and burritos are a big deal in fine dining. The problem with buzzwords in tech, though, is that they potentially actually affect your life. When somebody calls an application "secure," to influence you to use their product, there's an implicit promise being made. "Secure" must mean that something's secure. It's safe for you to use and trust. The problem is, the word "secure" can actually refer to any number of things, and the tech industry often uses it as such a general term that it becomes ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Security buzzwords to avoid and what to say instead

Fast forward to Monday, the 8th of August, 2022, when I watched Bolaji's video on contributing to open source. I felt pumped again, but I wanted to apply what I learned, so I noted some steps.

articles.author: Moshe Zadka
articles.description:
PyLint: The good, the bad, and the ugly
Moshe Zadka
Mon, 09/19/2022 - 03:00

            
Hot take: PyLint is actually good!
"PyLint can save your life" is an exaggeration, but not as much as you might think! PyLint can keep you from really really hard to find and complicated bugs. At worst, it can save you the time of a test run. At best, it can help you avoid complicated production mistakes.
The good
I'm embarrassed to say how common this can be. Naming tests is perpetually weird: Nothing cares about the name, and there's often not a natural name to be found. For instance, look at this code:
def test_add_small():
# Math, am I right?
assert 1 + 1 == 3
def test_add_large():
assert 5 + 6 == 11
def test_add_small():
assert 1 + 10 == 11

The test works:
collected 2 items ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†‚Ä¶
articles.title: PyLint: The good, the bad, and the ugly

NASA‚Äôs SLS on the pad on September 3rd, 2022 | Photo by Joe Burbank / Orlando Sentinel / Tribune News Service via Getty Images
    

  
I‚Äôve got good news and bad news for fans of big NASA space launches. 
The good news is that after repeated delays and a nail-biting test of a leaky fuel system, NASA‚Äôs Space Launch System (SLS) could make its big debut as soon as Tuesday. The bad news is currently named Tropical Depression Nine. It‚Äôs a developing storm in the Caribbean with the potential to become a major hurricane and a trajectory that is currently headed toward Florida. 
There is just a 20 percent chance that the weather on September 27th will cooperate, according to a Friday forecast from the Space Force‚Äôs 45th weather squadron, which is in charge of determining whether or not the weather is good enough to launch.
This particular launch will be the start of Artemis I,...

articles.title: NASA‚Äôs Artemis I launch faces a new obstacle: the weather

The benefits of AI without the drawbacks of the cloud. | Kristen Radtke / The Verge; Getty Images
    

  
OpenAI, the company behind image-generation and meme-spawning program DALL-E and the powerful text autocomplete engine GPT-3, has launched a new, open-source neural network meant to transcribe audio into written text (via TechCrunch). It‚Äôs called Whisper, and the company says it ‚Äúapproaches human level robustness and accuracy on English speech recognition‚Äù and that it can also automatically recognize, transcribe, and translate other languages like Spanish, Italian, and Japanese.
As someone who‚Äôs constantly recording and transcribing interviews, I was immediately hyped about this news ‚Äî I thought I‚Äôd be able to write my own app to securely transcribe audio right from my computer. While cloud-based services like Otter.ai and Trint work for...

articles.title: I used OpenAI‚Äôs new tech to transcribe audio right on my laptop

One of the world‚Äôs first plants for the production of green hydrogen in Wesseling, Germany, on July 2nd, 2021. | Photo by INA FASSBENDER/AFP via Getty Images
    

  
Ramping up production of hydrogen fuel is now a high priority for the Biden administration as it tries to put an end to the fossil fuel pollution causing climate change. The Department of Energy wants to produce 10 million metric tons of ‚Äúclean‚Äù hydrogen by 2030, according to a draft National Clean Hydrogen Strategy and Roadmap released yesterday. 
About 10 million metric tons of hydrogen is already produced in the US each year, but that‚Äôs mostly ‚Äúgray‚Äù hydrogen made with dirty natural gas. The shift would be to pair that natural gas with controversial technologies that capture carbon dioxide emissions as well as make more hydrogen using renewable energy sources and nuclear energy. 
‚ÄúA high priority technology for this administration‚Äù

Trombone Champ has been the star of my timeline this week; I‚Äôm constantly running into absurd renditions of songs like ‚ÄúTake Me Out to the Ball Game.‚Äù But in a conversation with Dan Vecchitto, the founder of Trombone Champ developer Holy Wow Studios, he brought up something I think is a major factor in the game‚Äôs success: we just don‚Äôt see a lot of comedy in gaming right now.
Games have been pushing the boundaries of capital-S Serious Storytelling for some time with series like The Last of Us. Others remain popular because of their high-skill and high-stress competitive multiplayer. But we just don‚Äôt see many games that embrace their own comedy in the way that Trombone Champ does.

The original AirPods Pro tips (left) have denser mesh than the new second-gen tips (right). | Photo by Chris Welch / The Verge
    

  
In my review of the new second-generation AirPods Pro, I pointed out that the inner mesh / filter of the ear tips is slightly different than those belonging to the original earbuds. As it turns out, that‚Äôs part of why Apple advises against using first-gen tips on the new model and vice versa. As MacRumors noticed, the company has updated its support page on AirPods Pro ear tips with a new section that says ‚Äúear tips have been designed specifically for their AirPods Pro generation, to deliver the highest-fidelity audio experience.‚Äù
‚ÄúAs a result, use the ear tips that come with your AirPods Pro. AirPods Pro (1st generation) ear tips have noticeably denser mesh than AirPods Pro (2nd generation) ear tips,‚Äù Apple‚Äôs support site reads.

Logitech‚Äôs budget-friendly G435 boasts color and comfort, as well as a host of solid features. | Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge
    

  
A good gaming headset is practically a necessity these days. Clean and precise audio is essential for competitive gaming, allowing you to pinpoint your enemies and communicate effectively with your teammates. Moreover, recent developments in spatial audio and virtual surround sound have allowed headsets to meet ‚Äî and occasionally surpass ‚Äî more expensive audio setups, allowing even the most budget-conscious gamer to obtain a competitive edge at a fraction of the price.
While you could always invest in a massive pair of speakers, they‚Äôre likely to earn you the dubious distinction of the worst roommate of the decade. Thankfully, the right headset will allow you to keep the running and gunning to yourself, which is why we‚Äôve rounded up a...

articles.description:
Remoelane.com from scratch with a new tech stack and it's my seventh startup which is part of the 24 Startups in 24 Months Challenge. The versions of Remotelane.com before were developed together with @sonnypgs. The other seventh startup from @sonnypgs is EpicAhead.

Remotelane.com is known as a remote job aggregator which shows up to 15 new remote jobs per hour from all around the web which will stay 30 days on the page. The search works simple with executing the search after stop typing for 1s without the need to press a button. 

The job post cell includes now a description which you can expand/collapse per click, also you can filter by categories and tags. The "Post a Remote Job" Feature is as simple as possible, just provide the job title, company name, job description, the link to apply or email to apply, choose a category and add up to five optional tags. Also the newsletter is just a simple list like the website itself.

A more detailed blogpost can be found here https://24startups24months.com/posts/7-startup-remotelane-com

If you should have questions or feedback, let us know in the comments below :) All feedback is welcome.

Cheers!
              ‚Äù

AI Image Enlarger was released three years ago, we have received quite a lot of emails, and users love using our AI tool to process their images. Now we have released a quite new tool of Bg Eraser that you can use for improving the productivity of the designing and creative works. 

ü§ì What is Bg Eraser and How Does it Work?
We have integrated an AI Inpainting model that could recognize and remove the objects, guess and regenerate the content backward. If you want to remove unwanted objects, people, text, and even watermarks from an image, you can try this tool, as that is what Bg Eraser can do.

Bg Eraser also enables you to remove the background from an image and make it background transparent. After that, you can use the editing tool to change the background color or images. Quite easy to start.

All in all, Bg Eraser provides two great features for your creative and designing works. Increase your productivity and clean up your pictures easily.

1.	Magic Eraser: Remove unwanted objects and retouch images with reliable quality.
2.	Background Eraser: Remove background from images in seconds.

üî• Why you should use BgEraser
Bg Eraser applies the latest and cut-edging technology that make your job easier.

Here are some features 
1. Remove objects from an image with the AI Inpainting technology
2. Remove background and create PNG images
3. 100 free to use and no account required
4. Unlimited access to the Magic Eraser tool
5. Reliable, fast and amazing.

üöÄ Roadmap
- More accurate when inpainting
- Make the process faster

Just drop me an email at support@bgeraser.com or leave your comments if you have any ideas. I would like to hear from you!
              ‚Äù

articles.description:
Versify. We have worked extremely hard to make the process so easy that someone with zero technical knowledge can create and airdrop an NFT to their entire customer list in less than 5 minutes. Seriously, try it here.

Here's what you can expect from Versify:
üèéÔ∏è Frictionless. Not familiar with blockchain? Don't own a crypto wallet? No problem at all. Versify has the crypto newcomers in mind, so we abstracted away all technical intricacies.
üòå Convenient. Already store your customer list in another app like Salesforce or Mailchimp? Perfect! With our pre-built integrations, you can instantly connect your other tools and automatically airdrop an NFT to any or all of your customers.
üí∞ Cost-effective. Did we mention that Versify is entirely free for up to 25 mints?

üé≤ SCAVENGER HUNT üé≤
In the spirit of some Product Hunt fun & creativity, we decided to create a mini scavenger hunt using Versify Mint Links. We have hidden three collectibles within this page and the Versify dashboard. Collect all 3 to redeem free premium access (up to 1,000 mints) to the platform for a month. We'll make the first one a freebie. Here it is.

We are so excited to build Versify with you and can't wait for you to try it. To get started, create your account here. We'd love to hear all feedback, suggestions, and questions.

Thank you all for your support and advice.
              ‚Äù
